headline: Green season offers genuine value with adjusted expectations
summary: Green season (November-May in East Africa) offers 30-40% lower prices, fewer tourists, dramatic skies, and lush landscapes. Wildlife is present year-round but more dispersed. For budget-conscious travelers or repeat visitors seeking a different experience, green season provides excellent value. First-timers prioritizing easy viewing may prefer dry season.

assumptions.text: Green season prices are typically 30-40% lower than peak dry season.
Wildlife is present year-round; only concentration and visibility change.
Rain typically falls in afternoon; mornings are usually clear for game drives.

change_conditions: If budget is the primary constraint, green season savings may enable longer trips.
If photography is priority, green season skies often produce more dramatic images.
If ease of viewing is essential, dry season is more reliable.
If traveling during green season, adjust expectations and embrace the different experience.
